intro: Psephellus leucophyllus, commonly known as the white-leaf psephellus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are distinctive for their white or pale green coloration, which sets it apart from other species in the genus. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
